name: Longsword
description:
Swordsman:

When you attack with a longsword, roll +Dex. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack inflicts a grievous wound, causing your target to take -1 ongoing to all rolls until they receive healing or medical attention
  • Your attack creates an opening, giving you or an ally +1 forward to their next attack against the target
  • Your attack stuns or knocks down your target, giving you or an ally an opportunity to quicklyact before they can react

Defensive Parry:

When you use a longsword to defend yourself, roll+Dex instead of +Con. On a 10+, you deflect theattack and take no damage. On a 7-9, you deflect the attack but suffer a -1 penalty to your nextattack roll.

name: Staff of Thunders
description:
Thunderstrike:

When you wield the staff of thunders and cast a spell that deals damage, you can choose to add the lightning tag to it. If you do, roll +Int. On a 10+, you deal your damage as normal and the target is deafened and stunned for a few moments. On a 7-9, you deal your damage as normal but the spell also affects you or an ally nearby, your choice. On a miss, the spell backfires and you take 1d6 damage.

Thunderclap:

When you slam the staff of thunders on the ground, you can spend one charge to create a loud thunderclap that can be heard for miles around. Anyone nearby who is not prepared for the noise must defy danger or be deafened and stunned for a few moments. The staff has 3 charges and regains one charge at dawn.

name: Shield of the Gryphon
description:
Gryphon’s Flight:

When you strap the shield of the gryphon on your arm and leap into the air, you can spend one charge to fly for a short distance. You can carry up to your load while flying. You can use this ability to cross gaps, reach high places, or escape danger. The shield has 3 charges and regains one charge at dawn.

Gryphon’s Roar:

When you hold the shield of the gryphon in front of you and shout a challenge, you can spend one charge to unleash a fearsome roar that echoes from the shield. Anyone who hears it must defy danger or flee in terror. The shield has 3 charges and regains one charge at dawn.

name: Helmet of Courage
description:
Courageous Aura:

When you wear the helmet of courage, you and your allies nearby are immune to fear effects. You also gain +1 ongoing to defy danger when you act despite danger or fear.

Courageous Inspiration:

When you wear the helmet of courage and rally your allies with a speech or a gesture, roll +Cha. On a 10+, you and your allies take +1 forward to your next rolls. On a 7-9, you or one ally of your choice takes +1 forward to their next roll.

name: Whistle of the Eagles
description:
Eagle’s Call:

When you blow the whistle of the eagles, you can summon an eagle to aid you. The eagle is loyal to you and will follow your commands as best as it can. You can communicate with it telepathically as long as it is within sight. The eagle has these stats: HP 6, Armor 1, Damage d6, Instinct: To soar.

Eagle’s Eye:

When you blow the whistle of the eagles and look through its eyes, you can see what it sees as if you were there. You can use this ability to scout ahead, spy on enemies, or find hidden things. You cannot see or hear anything else while using this ability.

name: Potion of Heroism
description:
Heroic Boost:

When you drink the potion of heroism, you feel a surge of courage and strength. For the next hour, you gain +1 to all your rolls and you can mark one additional option when you hack and slash or volley. You also ignore the effects of fear, pain, and exhaustion. However, after the hour is over, you suffer a -1 ongoing to all your rolls until you rest.

name: Crossbow
description:
Crossbow Expert:

When you attack with a crossbow, roll +Dex. On a 10+, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 7-9, you deal your damage and reload. On a miss, you have to spend a few moments to reload before you can fire again.

  • Your attack pierces armor, ignoring 1 point of armor
  • Your attack hits an additional target within range
  • Your attack pins your target to a wall or the ground, preventing them from moving until they free themselves

name: Heavy Crossbow
description:
Heavy Crossbow Expert:

When you attack with a heavy crossbow, roll +Str. On a 10+, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 7-9, you deal your damage and reload. On a miss, you have to spend a few moments to reload before you can fire again.

  • Your attack pierces armor, ignoring 2 points of armor
  • Your attack knocks your target back or off balance
  • Your attack deals +1d4 damage

name: Simple Bow
description:
Bow Expert:

When you attack with a simple bow, roll +Dex. On a 10+, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 7-9, you deal your damage. On a miss, you lose one ammo.

  • Your attack is silent and unnoticed
  • Your attack hits an additional target within range
  • Your attack deals +1d4 damage if you have the high ground or surprise

name: Composite Bow
description:
Composite Bow Expert:

When you attack with a composite bow, roll +Dex. On a 10+, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 7-9, you deal your damage. On a miss, you lose one ammo.

  • Your attack pierces armor, ignoring 1 point of armor
  • Your attack hits an additional target within range
  • Your attack deals +1d6 damage if you have the high ground or surprise

name: Longbow
description:
Longbow Expert:

When you attack with a longbow, roll +Dex. On a 10+, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 7-9, you deal your damage. On a miss, you lose one ammo.

  • Your attack has extreme range, reaching targets far beyond normal sight
  • Your attack hits an additional target within range
  • Your attack deals +1d8 damage if you have the high ground or surprise

name: Arquebus
description:
Arquebus Expert:

When you attack with an arquebus, roll +Dex. On a 10+, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 7-9, you deal your damage and reload. On a miss, you have to spend a few moments to reload before you can fire again.

  • Your attack pierces armor, ignoring 2 points of armor
  • Your attack creates a loud bang and a flash of fire, startling or scaring anyone nearby who is not prepared for it
  • Your attack deals +1d6 damage and sets your target or something nearby on fire

name: Heavy Blunderbuss
description:
Heavy Blunderbuss Expert:

When you attack with a heavy blunderbuss, roll +Str. On a 10+, you deal your damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 7-9, you deal your damage and reload. On a miss, you have to spend a few moments to reload before you can fire again.

  • Your attack pierces armor, ignoring 3 points of armor
  • Your attack creates a loud bang and a flash of fire, stunning or scaring anyone nearby who is not prepared for it
  • Your attack deals +1d8 damage and sets your target and anything nearby on fire

name: Club
description:
Brutal Smash:

When you attack with a club, roll +Str. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack breaks or damages something your target is holding or wearing
  • Your attack sends your target flying or sprawling, giving you or an ally an opportunity to quickly act before they can recover
  • Your attack dazes or disorients your target, giving them -1 forward to their next roll

Heavy Swing:

When you use a club to hack and slash, you can choose to take -1 to the roll. If you do, you add +2 to the damage you deal on a hit.

name: Dagger
description:
Backstab:

When you attack a surprised or defenseless enemy with a dagger, roll +Dex. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage +1d6. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage +1d6 and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • You don’t get into melee with them
  • You create an advantage for an ally, giving them +1 forward against the target
  • You reduce their armor by 1 until they repair it

Quick Draw:

When you use a dagger to volley, you can draw and throw it as one fluid motion. You do not have to mark off ammo when you do this.

name: Estoc
description:
Pierce Armor:

When you attack with an estoc, roll +Str. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage and ignore the target’s armor. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and ignore the target’s armor and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack causes severe bleeding, dealing an extra 1d4 damage at the start of each of the target’s turns until they receive healing or medical attention
  • Your attack impales your target, pinning them to a nearby surface or object
  • Your attack exposes a weakness in your target’s defense, giving you or an ally +1 forward to their next attack against the target

Precise Thrust:

When you use an estoc to discern realities about an enemy’s combat style or weakness, you get +1 to the roll.

name: Halberd
description:
Sweeping Strike:

When you attack with a halberd, roll +Str. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack hits an additional nearby enemy
  • Your attack pushes your target back
  • Your attack deals +1d4 damage

Reach Advantage:

When you use a halberd to defy danger by keeping enemies at bay, you get +1 to the roll.

name: Pike
description:
Skirmisher:

When you attack with a pike, roll +Dex. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack keeps your target at a distance, preventing them from closing in on you or an ally
  • Your attack allows you to move to a different position without provoking an opportunity attack
  • Your attack deals +1d4 damage

Piercing Strike:

When you use a pike to hack and slash, you can choose to take -1 to the roll. If you do, you ignore the target’s armor on a hit.

name: Greatsword
description:
Berserker:

When you attack with a greatsword, roll +Str. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack cleaves through multiple enemies, dealing your HA damage to another nearby enemy
  • Your attack unleashes a battle cry, inspiring fear or awe in your enemies and giving you or an ally +1 forward against them
  • Your attack deals +1d6 damage

Reckless Swing:

When you use a greatsword to hack and slash, you can choose to expose yourself to danger. If you do, you add +2 to the damage you deal on a hit.

name: Greataxe
description:
Slayer:

When you attack with a greataxe, roll +Str. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack severs a limb or appendage of your target, disabling them in some way
  • Your attack triggers a blood frenzy, giving you +1 forward to your next attack roll
  • Your attack deals +1d8 damage

Savage Chop:

When you use a greataxe to hack and slash, you can choose to take -1 to the roll. If you do, you add +4 to the damage you deal on a hit.

name: Greathammer
description:
Crusher:

When you attack with a greathammer, roll +Str. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack shatters or crushes something your target is holding or wearing
  • Your attack sends a shockwave, knocking down or stunning nearby enemies
  • Your attack deals +1d10 damage

Smite Evil:

When you use a greathammer to hack and slash an enemy of your deity or cause, you can choose to take -1 to the roll. If you do, you add +2d4 to the damage you deal on a hit.

name: Shortsword
description:
Duelist:

When you attack with a shortsword, roll +Dex. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack disarms your target, making them drop something they are holding
  • Your attack allows you to evade an incoming attack, giving you +1 armor until your next turn
  • Your attack deals +1d4 damage

Quick Slash:

When you use a shortsword to hack and slash, you can choose to roll twice and take the better result. If you do, you expose yourself to danger.

name: Longsword
description:
Swordsman:

When you attack with a longsword, roll +Dex. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack inflicts a grievous wound, causing your target to take -1 ongoing to all rolls until they receive healing or medical attention
  • Your attack creates an opening, giving you or an ally +1 forward to their next attack against the target
  • Your attack stuns or knocks down your target, giving you or an ally an opportunity to quicklyact before they can react

Defensive Parry:

When you use a longsword to defend yourself, roll+Dex instead of +Con. On a 10+, you deflect theattack and take no damage. On a 7-9, you deflect the attack but suffer a -1 penalty to your nextattack roll.

name: Axe
description:
Hacker:

When you attack with an axe, roll +Str. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack chops off a limb or appendage of your target, disabling them in some way
  • Your attack triggers a blood frenzy, giving you +1 forward to your next attack roll
  • Your attack deals +1d6 damage

Rage:

When you use an axe to hack and slash, you can choose to take -1 to the roll. If you do, you add +2 to the damage you deal on a hit.

name: Mace
description:
Crusader:

When you attack with a mace, roll +Str. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack shatters or crushes something your target is holding or wearing
  • Your attack sends a shockwave, knocking down or stunning nearby enemies
  • Your attack deals +1d4 damage

Divine Smite:

When you use a mace to hack and slash an enemy of your deity or cause, you can choose to take -1 to the roll. If you do, you add +2d4 to the damage you deal on a hit.

name: Gambeson armor
description:
Cushion:

When you wear gambeson armor, you get +1 armor (armor reduces the damage you receive). When you take damage from a blunt weapon or an arrow while wearing gambeson armor, you can choose to damage your armor (reduce its armor value by 1) to reduce the damage by an additional 1d4.

Stealthy:

When you use gambeson armor to defy danger by sneaking or hiding, you get +1 to the roll. This armor is quiet and can be dyed to match different environments.

name: Plate armor
description:
Deflect:

When you wear plate armor, you get +3 armor (armor reduces the damage you receive). When you take damage from a slashing or piercing weapon while wearing plate armor, you can roll a d6. On a 6, you ignore the damage completely. On a 1-5, you can choose to damage your armor (reduce its armor value by 1) to reduce the damage by an additional 1d6.

Cushion:

When you take damage from a blunt weapon or an arrow while wearing plate armor, you can choose to damage your armor (reduce its armor value by 1) to reduce the damage by an additional 1d4.

Bulky:

When you use plate armor to defy danger by being stealthy, agile, or swimming, you get -2 to the roll. When you take damage from electricity or magnetism while wearing plate armor, you take +1d8 damage and must defy danger to avoid being stunned or immobilized. This armor is made of metal, which conducts and attracts these forces.

name: Chainmail armor
description:
Dissipative:

When you wear chainmail armor, you get +2 armor (armor reduces the damage you receive). When you take damage from fire or acid while wearing chainmail armor, you can choose to damage your armor (reduce its armor value by 1) to reduce the damage by an additional 1d8.

Cushion:

When you take damage from a blunt weapon or an arrow while wearing chainmail armor, you can choose to damage your armor (reduce its armor value by 1) to reduce the damage by an additional 1d4.

Clumsy:

When you use chainmail armor to defy danger by being stealthy or agile, you get -1 to the roll. This armor is noisy and heavy, making you more noticeable and slower.

name: Round Shield
description:
Shield Bash:

When you attack with a round shield, roll +Str. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage and push your target back. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack dazes or disorients your target, giving you or an ally +1 forward to their next attack against them
  • Your attack knocks your target off balance, giving you or an ally an opportunity to quickly act before they can recover
  • Your attack breaks or damages your target's weapon or armor, reducing its effectiveness

Shatter Shield:

When you take damage that would harm or kill you, you can choose to break your round shield and ignore the damage. You can only do this once per shield.

name: Kite Shield
description:
Covering Fire:

When you use a kite shield to defend yourself or an ally from ranged attacks, roll+Con. On a 10+, you deflect or block the attacks and take no damage. On a 7-9, you deflect or block the attacks but suffer a -1 penalty to your next action.

Shatter Shield:

When you take damage that would harm or kill you, you can choose to break your kite shield and ignore the damage. You can only do this once per shield.

name: Pavise Shield
description:
Deploy Shield:

When you set up a pavise shield as a cover, roll +Con. On a 7-9, you and anyone behind the shield gain +1 armor against ranged attacks. On a 10+, you and anyone behind the shield gain +2 armor against ranged attacks and are immune to explosions. On a 12+, you also gain +1 forward to your next action from behind the shield.

Shield Breaker:

When you attack with a pavise shield, roll +Str. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage and force your target to give ground. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack shatters or splinters your target's shield or armor, reducing its effectiveness
  • Your attack pushes your target into a dangerous position, such as off a cliff or into a trap
  • Your attack intimidates or demoralizes your target, causing them to surrender or flee

name: Buckler
description:
Quick Strike:

When you attack with a buckler, roll +Dex. On a 7-9, you deal your HA damage and gain +1 armor until your next action. On a 10+, you deal your HA damage and choose one additional effect from the list below. On a 12+, you can choose two effects.

  • Your attack exposes or exploits a weakness in your target's defense, giving you or an ally +1 forward to their next attack against them
  • Your attack disarms or distracts your target, giving you or an ally an opportunity to quickly act before they can react
  • Your attack stuns or wounds your target, causing them to take -1 ongoing to all rolls until they receive healing or medical attention

Dodge and Parry:

When you use a buckler to defend yourself in close quarters, roll+Dex instead of +Con. On a 10+, you evade or deflect the attack and take no damage. On a 7-9, you evade or deflect the attack but suffer a -1 penalty to your next action.

name: Adventuring Gear
description:
Have What You Need:

When you rummage through your adventuring gear for some useful mundane item, mark off a use and you have it. The GM might ask you what it looks like or how you got it.

name: Bag of Books
description:
Bookworm:

When you spout lore about something and your bag of books contains just the right book for the subject, mark off a use and take +1 to your roll.

name: Halfling Pipeleaf
description:
Friendly Smoke:

When you share halfling pipeleaf with someone, expend two uses and take +1 forward to parley with them. The GM might also tell you something interesting or useful that they reveal during the conversation.

name: Bandages
description:
Patch Up:

When you have a few minutes to bandage someone else’s wounds, mark off a use and heal them 4 damage.

Tender Care:

When you carefully treat someone else’s wounds with bandages and rest, mark off a use and heal them 7 damage.

name: Large Backpack / Bag
description:
Carry On:

A large backpack or bag can hold up to 25 load of items. You can access any item in your backpack or bag with ease.

name: Small Crate, Sack or Chest
description:
Store Away:

A small crate, sack or chest can hold up to 20 load of items. You need to spend some time to find a specific item in your crate, sack or chest.

name: Big Crate, Sack or Chest
description:
Store Away:

A big crate, sack or chest can hold up to 40 load of items. You need to spend some time to find a specific item in your crate, sack or chest.

name: Antitoxin
description:
Poison Cure:

When you drink antitoxin, cure one poison affecting you. The GM will tell you what effects the poison had and how you feel after taking the antitoxin.

name: Small Backpack / Bag
description:
Carry On:

A small backpack or bag can hold up to 6 load of items. You can access any item in your backpack or bag with ease.

name: Medium Backpack / Bag
description:
Carry On:

A medium backpack or bag can hold up to 13 load of items. You can access any item in your backpack or bag with ease.

name: Dungeon Rations
description:
Sustenance:

When you consume a ration, mark off a use and you don’t need to eat for a day. Dungeon rations are bland but nourishing.

name: Dwarven Hardtack Ration
description:
Sustenance:

When you consume a ration, mark off a use and you don’t need to eat for a day. Dwarven hardtack rations are tough and dry but filling.

Stout Heart:

When you consume a ration, you can also choose to take +1 forward to your next defy danger roll with CON.

name: Elven Bread Ration
description:
Sustenance:

When you consume a ration, mark off a use and you don’t need to eat for a day. Elven bread rations are light and sweet but satisfying.

Graceful Step:

When you consume a ration, you can also choose to take +1 forward to your next defy danger roll with DEX.

name: A Hearty Meal for One
description:
Nourishment:

When you enjoy a hearty meal for one, you heal 2 damage and remove one debility of your choice.

Comfort:

When you enjoy a hearty meal for one, you can also choose to take +1 forward to your next parley or discern realities roll.

name: A Poor Meal for a Family
description:
Sustenance:

When you share a poor meal for a family, you and up to three others don’t need to eat for a day. A poor meal for a family is meager and bland but enough to survive.

Hardship:

When you share a poor meal for a family, you can also choose to take +1 forward to your next defy danger roll with WIS.

name: A Feast
description:
Nourishment:

When you partake in a feast, you heal 4 damage and remove two debilities of your choice.

Celebration:

When you partake in a feast, you can also choose to take +1 forward to your next carouse or aid or interfere roll.

name: 1 kg of Wheat
description:
Bread and Butter:

When you use 1 kg of wheat to make bread or other food, mark off the wheat and you have enough food for one person for a day.

Barter Goods:

When you trade 1 kg of wheat with someone who needs it, mark off the wheat and take +1 forward to your next parley roll with them.

name: 1 kg of Steel
description:
Material:

When you use 1 kg of steel to craft or repair a weapon or armor, mark off the steel and you have enough material for the job.

Barter Goods:

When you trade 1 kg of steel with someone who needs it, mark off the steel and take +1 forward to your next parley roll with them.

name: 1 kg of Gold
description:
Money:

When you use 1 kg of gold to buy something, mark off the gold and you have enough money for the purchase. 1 kg of gold is equivalent to 100
